title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: This droll old tippling sinner was a joker in his way, and to Lockhart and his friends, a subject of constant mystifications and quizzes which he partly saw through ; but his uncommon vanity mado him like the notice, and when at last the wags began to publish songs and ballads in his name, 0, then, he could not resist going into the delusion ! and though he had a horrid bad voice and hardly any ear, he would roar and sing the songs in every company as his own.
